Package Game

Class Fruit

  • java.lang.Object
    • GIS.GIS_element_obj
      • Game.Fruit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GIS_element
    public class Fruit
extends GIS_element_obj
    This class represents a Fruit object inside our game (target) it extends the GIS_element_obj, and will also hold these extra fields: Weight of this fruit, a boolean isEaten to indicate whether the fruit has been eaten by a pacman, an ID integer, and a long timeToEat which will indicate how long it took to eat this fruit in the last Algorithm Solution run.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fruit

        public Fruit​(Geom_element geometryOfElement,
             Meta_data_element dataOfElement,
             int ID)
        Constructor for the Fruit object. gets a Geom_element, Meta_data_element and ID. default value for weight will be 1. isEaten is set to False.
        Parameters:
        geometryOfElement - Geom_element, the geometry object of the element.
        dataOfElement - Meta_data, the data of the element.
        ID - Integer, ID for this fruit.

      • Fruit

        public Fruit​(Geom_element geometryOfElement,
             Meta_data_element dataOfElement,
             int ID,
             double weight)
        Constructor for the Fruit object. gets a Geom_element, Meta_data_element, ID and weight. default value for isEaten is set to False.
        Parameters:
        geometryOfElement - Geom_element, the geometry object of the element.
        dataOfElement - Meta_data, the data of the element.
        ID - Integer, ID for this fruit.
        weight - double, the weight of this fruit.

      • Fruit

        public Fruit​(java.lang.String line)
        Constructor for the Fruit object. gets a String representing all data to build a fruit object.
        Parameters:
        line - String containing all data for the Fruit object separated by commas , .

        public void updateGeom​(java.lang.String firstBoardLine)
